entry.title: Game: A King's Tale: Final Fantasy 15 (PS4, 2016)
entry.content:
Game: A King's Tale: Final Fantasy 15 (PS4, 2016)20170911
I played through and beat this game on the normal difficulty. It
was a pretty fun, simple brawler. Although it only lasted an hour,
it was almost a little too long.

entry.content:

way to start the show. I especially like that Lex wants to be
buddies with Clark.

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 1 - Winter Is Coming (5)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 1 - Episode 1 - Winter Is Coming (5)20170911
I am taking part in the "And now my re-watch begins" where you
watch one episode a week until season 8 comes out. It is so much
fun to start the show again and she all my favorite characters
before they know what will happen to them. I love the symbolism
in this episode of what will come.

I loved the way that Ned looked when he realized he had to
protect Robert, even though he wasn't great. It reminds me of the
stoicism that Jon will have later.

Wow, someone on the reddit mentioned that Theon thought a
mountain lion (Lannister) killed the stag (Baratheon) which
killed the dire wolf (Starks). Cool!

I like another comment that Jon and Sansa really want to go out
into the world, but their elders tell them it's a bad idea.

It's crazy to think at this point that Tyrion and Jon will be
allies.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game: Muramasa Rebirth (Vita, 2013) (11)
entry.content:
Game: Muramasa Rebirth (Vita, 2013) (11)20170908
I got the accessories I needed for Kisuke by doing the Dragon God
again then the White Cave in Ise. I still couldn't equip the Oboro
Muramasa, so I did the cave again and now I can if I equip the
right secondary sword. Now I can go get Kisuke's third ending.

entry.content:

This was meh... it was a bit exciting but you kind of knew
everything that was going to happen. I thought everyone was pretty
bad in the movie, but obviously Tessa was crazy.

entry.content:

that Peter was at.

entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 7 - The Dragon and the Wolf (2)20170903
I love that, of course, Cersei will trust Jon. He's so noble. I

Yikes.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 2 - Stormborn (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 2 - Stormborn (2)20170902
I get moist eyed a lot while watching this show... when people
talk all brave and selfless.

Littlefinger is constantly being beaten up by Starks. His whole
life.

It is interesting to see how it would have been better for Dany
to have taken Olenna's advice more quickly.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 3 - The Queen's Justice (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 3 - The Queen's Justice (2)20170902
I love their faces when the dragons fly by.

Cersei is so brutal.

It is very interesting watching it a second time. For instance,
Littlefinger perks up when Wolken says that there's an archive of
every raven scroll.

"The Climate" :)

I love all the remixes of the Rains of Castamere.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 4 - The Spoils of War (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 4 - The Spoils of War (2)20170902
Jon never does see Bran or Arya this season, although he does
find out they are alive.

It is very cute when Jon and Dany are together.

Arya's fight scene was so awesome.

The ending sequence was so amazing. I loved the feeling of being
there you got when Bronne was running around frantically.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 5 - Eastwatch (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 5 - Eastwatch (2)20170902
It's amazing to imagine people turning to ash before your eyes.

Cersei's words makes me think she doesn't need the wight to be
convinced. But they wouldn't get Jaime that way.

I like Jon always goes to the front. He's like Ned, he doesn't
expect others to do things for him.

Dany's look when Jon leaves is great.

I hope Sam got something useful from his library raid.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 6 - Beyond the Wall (3)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 6 - Beyond the Wall (3)20170902
It is so funny when the Hound tells off Gendry.

It is cool to hear ravens in the background when Sansa &
Littlefinger are talking.

The wight is tied up, which means that it either broke out while
in the box or they deliberately untied to make a bigger
impression when they let it out. I like the second idea!
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 1 - Dragonstone (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 1 - Dragonstone (2)20170901
Arya is so awesome.

I wonder what Robin is doing down in the Vale? He doesn't show up
all season.

I really like the scene with Jon and the Umbers & Karstarks. It
is interesting to remember that they will be the first castle
attacked by the White Walkers.

entry.title: Book: Bitterblue, by Kristin Cashore (2012) (2)
entry.content:
Book: Bitterblue, by Kristin Cashore (2012) (2)20170901
I finished it today. It was really quite disturbing... a whole book
about a whole nation recovering from being rape victims. Pretty
grim. I would have liked to have some more about what Leck was
trying to do... I imagine him trying to create and understand
Gracelings. The introduction of Fire at the end was a little bit
too easily wrapped up without enough punch to it.
  • Books
  • 2012
